Class EasterCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • EasterCalculator

  • public class EasterCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    The EasterCalculator class exists purely for computing parameters to create or edit the EasterDate class object. Because of this all methods within the EasterCalculator class only require one instance and so are static. This class contains two methods. The method easterFinder implements the Meeus/Jones/Butcher algorithm for computing the date of easter given the year. The easterDateIgnoreYear method simply removes the year from the DateCounter object for later computational purposes.
    Since:
    1.8
    Author:
    Kyle Dorcey

      static EasterDate easterDateIgnoreYear(int year)

      static EasterDate easterFinder(int year)
      This method implements the Meeus/Jones/Butcher algorithm in order to compute the date and month of Easter when given the year.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EasterCalculator

    • Method Detail

      • easterFinder

        public static EasterDate easterFinder(int year)
        This method implements the Meeus/Jones/Butcher algorithm in order to compute the date and month of Easter when given the year. After determining the month and date of a year's Easter the method will create a EasterDate class- object for the specified month, day, and year.
        Parameters:
        year - Integer representing the year which the algorithm computes.
        Returns:
        This method returns an EasterDate class-object for the computer date of Easter. The class-object's constructor is called earlier in the method.

      • easterDateIgnoreYear

        public static EasterDate easterDateIgnoreYear(int year)
        The method easterDateIgnoreYear calls the easterFinder method but returns an object only containing an Easter's day and month. This is used for computational purposes later on.
        Parameters:
        year - Integer representation of the year which is passed to easterFinder to compute.
        Returns:
        returns a EasterDate class-object representing the date of Easter in a given year, but with the year removed.
